Term.definition: FIFO is an abbreviation for first in, first out, a method of handling data structures where the first element is processed first and the most recent element is processed last.
Queue is a data structure that follows the FIFO (first in, first out) approach, where the first element added is the first to be processed.
Queue is a data structure that follows the FIFO (first in, first out) approach, where the first element added is the first to be processed.
In Kotlin, `generateSequence` is a function to create a sequence where each subsequent element is generated based on the provided logic or condition.
In Kotlin, sequences are lazy collections that generate elements on-the-fly and do not store elements like collections.
In Kotlin, sequences are lazy collections that generate elements on-the-fly and do not store elements like collections.
FIFO stands for First-In, First-Out, a method where the first element added to a queue is the first one to be removed.
LIFO stands for Last-In, First-Out, a method where the most recently added element is the first one to be removed.
The ArrayDeque class in Kotlin provides constant time performance for inserting and removing items on both ends of the queue, making it suitable for scenarios requiring quick access from both ends.
Sets of key-value pairs where keys are unique, and each key maps to exactly one value, while values can be duplicated.
Sets of key-value pairs where keys are unique, and each key maps to exactly one value, while values can be duplicated.
Sets of key-value pairs where keys are unique, and each key maps to exactly one value, while values can be duplicated.
Sets of key-value pairs where keys are unique, and each key maps to exactly one value, while values can be duplicated.
A doubly linked HashMap implementation in Kotlin that preserves the injection order during iteration and offers O(1) for adding and reading by key.
In Kotlin, emptyMap is an implementation that returns the same singleton instance every time it is called, saving allocations for efficient program execution.
In Kotlin, emptyMap is an implementation that returns the same singleton instance every time it is called, saving allocations for efficient program execution.
FIFO (First-In-First-Out) is a programming approach where the first element added to a queue is the first one to be removed.
LIFO (Last-In-First-Out) is a programming approach where the last element added to a stack is the first one to be removed.
The toColor function in Kotlin converts a string representation of a color to a Color object.
The toPhotoCharacters function converts elements from a source collection to a PhotoCharacter.
VegetableType is a type used to categorize vegetables, such as VegetableType.Tomato, in the `getTomatoesForSoup` function.
KitchenImpl.put is a function that puts an item into the kitchen as part of the tomato preparation process.
KitchenImpl.cut is a function used to cut elements such as tomatoes in the kitchen during soup preparation.
KitchenImpl.take is a function that is used to take items, such as cut tomatoes, after they are prepared in the kitchen.
PotImpl.put is a function that places prepared items, such as chopped tomatoes, into the pot for cooking.
FridgeImpl is a class providing the necessary API to get vegetables like tomatoes from the fridge.
A function that retrieves baskets of all available fruits, places each basket in the kitchen, takes a specified capacity of fruits from each basket, and sorts the fruits by their sugar content.
A function that accepts a list of fruits, adds each fruit to the blender, and blends the ingredients together to make a smoothie.
An enum class that includes a `sugarContent` property, representing the sugar content of each fruit type.
An object that has a mutable list of 'vegetables' to store and offers methods to manage this list.
A method in 'FridgeImpl' that builds a list of 'Vegetable' entries according to specific rules such as generating random vegetables with random freshness.
A method in 'FridgeImpl' that clears all vegetables from the list, generates new ones using the 'generateRandomVegetables' function, and adds them to the list of 'vegetables'.
A method in 'FridgeImpl' that clears all vegetables from the list, generates new ones using the 'generateRandomVegetables' function, and adds them to the list of 'vegetables'.
A Kotlin function to generate a random boolean value.
LIFO is an abbreviation for 'last in, first out', a method of handling data structures in which the last element is processed first and the first element is processed last.
A stack is a data structure that operates on the LIFO (last in, first out) principle, where the last element added is the first one to be removed.
A stack is a data structure that operates on the LIFO (last in, first out) principle, where the last element added is the first one to be removed.
removeFirstOrNull is a built-in Kotlin function that removes and returns the first element of a collection or returns `null` if the collection is empty.
removeLastOrNull is a built-in Kotlin function that removes and returns the last element of a collection or returns `null` if the collection is empty.

The ArrayDeque class provides constant time performance for inserting and removing items from both ends of the queue, making it suitable for scenarios requiring flexibility in queue or stack operations.
A built-in Kotlin function that retrieves elements from a collection matching a given condition.
A built-in Kotlin function that retrieves elements from a collection matching a given condition.
A Kotlin function that filters ducks with a 'hasKotlinAttribute' field set to true, applicable to both `List` and `Set`.
A Kotlin function that filters elements in a map based on their keys.
A Kotlin function that filters elements in a map based on their values.
In Kotlin, a List is a regular collection that contains elements and allows for operations to be performed on all elements at once.
In Kotlin, a List is a regular collection that contains elements and allows for operations to be performed on all elements at once.
In Kotlin, a Sequence is a collection-like structure that does not contain elements but produces them during iteration, enabling lazy computations.
In Kotlin, a Sequence is a collection-like structure that does not contain elements but produces them during iteration, enabling lazy computations.
In Kotlin, a Sequence is a collection-like structure that does not contain elements but produces them during iteration, enabling lazy computations.
In Kotlin, a Sequence is a collection-like structure that does not contain elements but produces them during iteration, enabling lazy computations.
Lazy computing refers to a computation technique where values are produced on demand and not all at once, as used in Kotlin sequences.
A set of classes and functions that provide predefined operations and functionalities.
A set of classes and functions that provide predefined operations and functionalities.
Representations of all items in the kitchen, divided into categories such as food, storage, and cooking.
Abstract types in programming that define a set of methods to be implemented by other classes.
A function from the `Duck.kt` file that gets all values from the `Duck` class and returns a random duck from this list.
A function from the `GameModeService` class to generate a new list with `MAX_NUMBER_OF_DUCKS` random ducks using the `generateRandomDuck` function.
A predefined variable in the `GameUtil.kt` file that represents the maximum number of ducks in a generated list.
A built-in property in Kotlin that retrieves all values from an enum class.
A built-in Kotlin function that extracts a random value from a list.
A built-in Kotlin function that divides a collection into two parts based on a given predicate or condition.
A built-in Kotlin function that divides a collection into two parts based on a given predicate or condition.
A Kotlin extension function to separate ducks with a Kotlin attribute from those without, applicable to List and Set collections.
A field in the Duck object that determines whether a duck has a Kotlin-related attribute (true or false).
A function that groups photos by hair type and then by the presence of hats within each hair type group, returning a flattened list of all grouped photos.
An operation in programming used to reduce a hierarchical or nested structure into a single, flat list or sequence.
An operation in programming used to reduce a hierarchical or nested structure into a single, flat list or sequence.
Extension functions allow you to extend any class with your own functionality without inheriting from it or using design patterns.
The 'toMutableList' function converts an immutable list to a mutable list.
The 'toMutableSet' function converts an immutable set to a mutable set.
The 'toMutableMap' function converts an immutable map to a mutable map.
The 'removeAt' function removes an element from a mutable list by index.
The 'remove' function removes an element directly from a mutable list, set, or map.
The 'remove' function removes an element directly from a mutable list, set, or map.
A collection usually contains a number of objects (this number may also be zero) of the same type, referred to as elements or items.
A collection usually contains a number of objects (this number may also be zero) of the same type, referred to as elements or items.
Lists are ordered collections with access to elements by indices, where the index of the first element is zero, and elements can occur more than once.
Lists are ordered collections with access to elements by indices, where the index of the first element is zero, and elements can occur more than once.
Lists are ordered collections with access to elements by indices, where the index of the first element is zero, and elements can occur more than once.
An array-based implementation of the List interface, efficient for reading and generally adding items but expensive for inserting or removing objects.
A linked list implementation where nodes are connected using pointers, efficient for insertion and deletion but requires traversal to find nodes by position.
A Kotlin function that returns the same singleton instance every time, enabling allocation-free and efficient list creation.
A Kotlin function that returns the same singleton instance every time, enabling allocation-free and efficient list creation.
A built-in Kotlin function used to shuffle a list of elements, enabling randomization of the list's ordering.
A built-in Kotlin function used to shuffle a list of elements, enabling randomization of the list's ordering.
A built-in Kotlin function used to take the first N elements from a list, based on the list's inherent order.
A built-in Kotlin function used to convert a list into a set, ensuring unique elements are retained.
A predefined variable in the `GameUtil.kt` file, used to set the maximum number of ducks in the set of random ducks.
Sets are collections of unique elements, representing a mathematical abstraction of a set: a group of objects without duplicates.
Sets are collections of unique elements, representing a mathematical abstraction of a set: a group of objects without duplicates.
Sets are collections of unique elements, representing a mathematical abstraction of a set: a group of objects without duplicates.
Sets are collections of unique elements, representing a mathematical abstraction of a set: a group of objects without duplicates.
LinkedHashSet is a set implementation in Kotlin that sorts elements in the set by default and provides efficient element access using the contains operation.
In Kotlin, emptySet is a function that returns a singleton instance of an empty set, enabling efficient, allocation-free usage.
In Kotlin, emptySet is a function that returns a singleton instance of an empty set, enabling efficient, allocation-free usage.
A collection type in Kotlin where data is stored in an ordered manner and operations are applied on each item.
A Kotlin collection type that allows operations to be applied lazily, processing items one by one and improving performance when handling large data sets.
A Kotlin feature that allows functions to be added to existing classes without modifying their source code.
A Kotlin operation that groups elements of a collection by a given key.
A Kotlin function that groups elements of a collection by a key returned from a keySelector function, producing a map where each key is associated with a list of corresponding elements.
A function applied to each element of the original collection in Kotlin's groupBy to determine the key for the resulting map.
A collection that represents an ordered group of elements, allowing duplicates.
A collection that contains unique elements and does not allow duplicates.
A collection of key-value pairs where keys are unique and each key maps to a single value.
A built-in function in Kotlin to retrieve elements from a collection that satisfy a specific condition.
A built-in function in Kotlin to divide a collection into two based on a given predicate.
A built-in function in Kotlin to return a randomly shuffled version of the collection.
A built-in function in Kotlin to arrange the elements of a collection in a specified order, typically ascending or descending.
`sortedBy` is a Kotlin function that sorts a list by the returned value of the passed function.
`sortedByDescending` is a Kotlin function that sorts a list in descending order by the returned value of the passed function.
`sum` is a Kotlin function that calculates the sum of elements in a list.
`sumOf` is a Kotlin function that calculates the sum of elements in a list after applying a transformation to each element.
A function in Kotlin that generates a sequence of random spices.
A function in Kotlin that accepts a sequence of spices and processes each item by fetching it from the shelf and putting it into the pot.
A file in the application containing instances of all possible objects such as 'shelf' for 'ShelfImpl', used to interact with the game's API.
A function in 'ShelfImpl' used to get a specific spice from the shelf.
A function in 'PotImpl' used to put a spice into the pot.
In Kotlin, a mutable collection allows modification of elements, supporting methods like 'add' and 'remove'.
In Kotlin, a mutable collection allows modification of elements, supporting methods like 'add' and 'remove'.
A Kotlin built-in function to create a read-only list collection.
A Kotlin method to transform a read-only list into a mutable list.
A Kotlin method to transform a read-only set into a mutable set.
A Kotlin method to transform a read-only map into a mutable map.
A built-in Kotlin function used to associate each item from a collection with a value and create a map.
Client-server architecture refers to a software design model where a client (frontend) communicates with a server (backend) to exchange data and perform tasks.
A built-in property in Kotlin's enum class to retrieve all constants of an enum.
A built-in property in Kotlin's enum class to retrieve all constants of an enum.
A property in Kotlin enum classes that provides the name of the enum constant as a string.
A property in Kotlin enum classes that provides the name of the enum constant as a string.
A property in Kotlin enum classes that provides the name of the enum constant as a string.
A built-in function in Kotlin to convert a string to lowercase.
